com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com armando the armadillo pattern difficulty medium i assume you already know how to crochet how to crochet in the round how to read a pattern and how to sew pieces together supplies size g hook will make approx 8 inch armadillo  a buff or light gray color for the body  a darker color for the nose and paws  crochet thread for the shell i used dmc senso crochet thread in rainbow cotton  safety eyes for live armadillo  very small amount of red for tongue for dead armadillo  embroidery thread for x eyes for dead armadillo gauge is unimportant for this project terms single_crochet = single_crochet increase = increase two single_crochet in same stitch decrease = decrease crochet two stitches together blo = back loops only crochet into the loop farthest away from you in the current stitch or into the back of the stitch note this armadillo and all parts except the shell are worked in the round i join rounds and i single_crochet in the same space as joining so i m assuming that at the end of each round you are slip stitching to the first stitch of that round and that you chain 1 to start the next round you can work in spirals if that s easier for you just remember to mark your rounds you want your stitches tight and close together so the stuffing doesn t show through later on to start each piece you can chain 2 and work your stitches into the 2nd stitch from the hook or you can use the magic adjustable loop page 2 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com the head and body row instructions stitches 1 **starting with darker color*** 4 chain 2 4 single_crochet in second chain from hook 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around including the slip_stitch from the previous round 5 3 single_crochet in each single_crochet around increase in last stitch 6 **change to main body color at the end of this row** 4 repeat row 3 7 5 repeat row 3 8 6 repeat row 3 9 7 8 work even single_crochet in each single_crochet around 9 9 *single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 12 10 *single_crochet in next 3 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 15 11 single_crochet in next 6 single_crochet increase in next 3 single_crochet single_crochet in last 6 single_crochet 18 12 work even 18 14 15 increase in first 3 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet in next 12 single_crochet increase in last
